properties.areaDesc: Greater Portland Metro Area; Central Willamette Valley
properties.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued January 9 at 8:08AM PST until January 9 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Portland OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Visibility less than one quarter mile in dense fog.
Visibility is as low as 200 feet in some areas.

* WHERE...Mainly western portions of the Portland metro area and
the Central Willamette Valley.

* WHEN...Until 11 AM PST this morning.

* IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.
Additionally, dense fog will make it difficult to see bicyclists
and pedestrians.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...With temperatures near freezing, there will
likely be areas of frost in outlying areas. The combination of
dense fog and frosty roads will make travel especially hazardous
on secondary roads in outlying areas.
properties.instruction:
If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of
distance ahead of you. Pedestrians and cyclists should wear
reflective clothing to increase the chance of being seen by
others.

NWSheadline: DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PST THIS MORNING
